title: Karle Hammond
text:
Karle Hammond (born ) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> (two spells), and in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> for <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>, the , the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford City Reds</a>, and the <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax Blue Sox</a>, as a or .
Background.
Hammond was born in <a href="Widnes">Widnes</a>, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>, England.
Career.
Hammond played as a in <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> 40-32 victory over the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in the <a href="1996%20Challenge%20Cup">1996 Challenge Cup</a> Final at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 27 April 1996 in front of a crowd of 78,550.
He was the top try-scorer of the <a href="1996%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour">1996 Great Britain Lions tour</a> of Papua New Guinea, Fiji and New Zealand.
Karle Hammond played in <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>' 16-25 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1995%E2%80%9396%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1995–96</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">Regal Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1995%E2%80%9396%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1995–96</a> at <a href="John%20Smith%27s%20Stadium">Alfred McAlpine Stadium</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 13 January 1996.
